text: today's recipe is really simple and
something great to have on hand all week
long for lunches dinners all kinds of
recipes where you need roasted chicken
salads grain bowls stuff like that this
is a simple roasted chicken thigh I just
added half a cup of olive oil to 8
bone-in skin-on chicken thighs if you
don't want to eat the skin that's
totally fine but we find that it tastes
more delicious and juicier if you cook
it with the skin on and it will be
broiled at the end to get really nice
and crispy again if you don't like it
remove it after it's cooked instead of
before it's cooked and it'll protect it
from getting dried out this is the juice
of one lemon it is a very very very
simple marinade of lemon juice olive oil
salt and pepper
so season with salt and pepper and then
you toss everything together and then
let it sit you can leave it at room
temperature to marinate like this for
about an hour if you want to do it for
longer you should refrigerate it make
sure you have an oiled roasting pan and
oven preheated to 375 degrees and what
you want to do is you can start these
roasting skin side down so fit them into
your roasting pan and then you get them
in 375 degree I mean you're gonna roast
from the skin down for 20 minutes and
then flip them and another 10 minutes
when the chicken has roasted for 30
minutes you're gonna want to glaze it
this is 2 tablespoons of honey mix that
with a tablespoon of grainy mustard and
some salt and pepper
very simple glaze this is a very simple
recipe like I said which is what makes
it so great and all-purpose
you can even make this recipe without
the glaze it's even simple but this adds
a really nice flavor and obviously if
you're gonna be eating the skin you want
it to taste super delish so then just
brush your chicken skin with the glaze
and have your oven set to broil so when
you take the chicken out of the oven
change the temperature from 375 to broil
that way the oven will be reheating
while you're glazing
you can make the glaze while your
chicken is resting so it's ready as soon
as the
chicken comes out of the oven and use up
all your glaze so be generous the
mustard gives Tang spice it's one of
those secret ingredients that we use all
the time when we need a lot of flavor
that's it you just get this back into
the oven but under the broiler for about
five minutes until the skin is crispy
and golden brown that's it just crispy
delicious chicken served with a nice
green salad or whatever is your
preferred way to serve your chicken and
enjoy any leftovers like I said they
would be great on grain bowls or in a
chicken salad it's completely up to you
and your imagination but I think you're
really gonna love this really simple
roasted chicken thighs if you like
recipes like this and you want more make
sure to click like and subscribe because
